instructions: Open Chrome. Tap on the 3-dot menu button. Select Settings . Select Privacy . Toggle Preload pages for faster browsing and searching on.
Open Chrome. Tap on the 3-dot menu button on the top-right corner. Select Settings . Select Search engine . Select your search engine of choice.
Open Chrome. Type Chrome://flags into the address bar and press enter. Search for Enable horizontal tab switcher . When the option shows up, tap on the drop-down menu and select Enabled .
Open Chrome. Type Chrome://flags into the address bar and press enter. Search for Tab Groups . When the option shows up, tap on the drop-down menu and select Enabled . Tap on Relaunch .
Open Chrome. Tap on the 3-dot menu button on the top-right corner. Select Settings . Select Accessibility . Check the Force enable zoom box.
Open Chrome. Tap on the 3-dot menu button on the top-right corner. Select Settings . Select Site settings . Select Media . Select Autoplay . Disable the feature.
Open Chrome. Type Chrome://flags into the address bar and press enter. Search for Parallel downloading . When the option shows up, tap on the drop-down menu and select Enabled .
Open Chrome. Type Chrome://flags into the address bar and press enter. Search for Reader mode triggering . When the option shows up, tap on the drop-down menu and select Always .
Open Chrome. Type Chrome://flags into the address bar and press enter. Search for Chrome duet . When the option shows up, tap on the drop-down menu and select Enabled . Tap on Relaunch .
Open Chrome. Tap on the 3-dot menu button on the top-right corner. Select Settings . Select Accessibility . Under Text scaling , drag the swiper left or right to change font size.
Open Chrome. Tap on the tab switcher button next to the address bar. Tap on the 3-dot menu button on the top-right. Select New incognito tab . Browse away!
